uk.recurse.bitwrapper

Class BitWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.recurse.bitwrapper.BitWrapper

  • public class BitWrapper
extends Object
    Wraps ByteBuffers and byte arrays with interfaces (referred to as views) which have annotated methods that describe slices of the buffer and the data type of each slice. Implementations of the view interfaces are generated dynamically at runtime and the slice described by each method is not extracted from the underlying buffer until the method is invoked. Invocations are not cached so any changes made to the buffer after wrapping will be visible in the view.

    Example view: 

    
 interface UdpPacket {
     @Bytes(length = 2)
     int sourcePort();
     @Bytes(offset = 2, length = 2)
     int destinationPort();
     @Bytes(offset = 4, length = 2)
     int length();
     @Bytes(offset = 6, length = 2)
     short checksum();
     @Bytes(offset = 8, lengthExp = "length() - 8")
     ByteBuffer payload();
 }
    Using the view: 
    
 BitWrapper wrapper = BitWrapper.create();
 UdpPacket udpPacket = wrapper.wrap(buffer, UdpPacket.class);
 int source = udpPacket.sourcePort();

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public <T> T wrap(ByteBuffer buffer,
                  Class<T> view)
        Returns an instance of a view backed by an underlying ByteBuffer. The portion of the buffer that the view will wrap is defined by its position and limit at the time it was wrapped. Modifications made to the buffer data after wrapping will be visible from the view, but changes made to mark, position and limit are not.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to wrap
        view - the view to use
        Returns:
        an instance of the view that wraps the ByteBuffer

      • wrap

        public <T> T wrap(byte[] bytes,
                  Class<T> view)
        Returns an instance of a view backed by an underlying byte array. Modifications made to the array data after wrapping will be visible from the view.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to wrap
        view - the view to use
        Returns:
        an instance of the view that wraps the byte array

      • create

        public static BitWrapper create()
        Returns a new instance that uses the decoders in the uk.recurse.bitwrapper.decoder package.

      • builder

        public static BitWrapper.Builder builder()
        Returns a new builder.
